Description: Upper body sherd of Attic white ground pottery alabastron; cream slip; exterior, from top: band of dots; multi-leaved encircled horizontal palmettes with added red in centre.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For a parallel, see Parlama, L. and Stampolidis, N. (eds), The City Beneath the City. Athens 2000, 330, no. 346 (with bibliography). There is no evidence of black figure related incision on the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0803) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
